response.overview: The Way of St James, the pilgrimage route to Santiago de Compostela in northwest Spain, is becoming ever more popular with the religious and non-religious alike. But some are not happy with the sheer numbers of people walking the camino, with numbers increasing sixfold over the last 20 years.
response.tagline: The Way of St James, the pilgrimage route to Santiago de Compostela in northwest Spain, is becoming ever more popular. But the sheer numbers of people walking the camino pose a challenge and cause problems for local communities.
response.title: Overtourism on the Camino
